item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Tuesday, September 10, 2024 at 2:40 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Nix 2.24+ is vulnerable to (remote) privilege escalation (32 points | 12 comments)
2. What is the best pointer tagging method? (35 points | 8 comments)
3. Redox OS 0.9.0 (53 points | 8 comments)
4. Apple Event for September 9th, 2024 (30 points | 3 comments)
5. Nobody Cares About Security (12 points | 9 comments)
6. Random access string compression with FSST and Rust (11 points | 6 comments)
7. QUIC is not Quick Enough over Fast Internet (35 points | 10 comments)
8. The Insecurity of Debian (15 points | 17 comments)
9. Bending Zed to render my beautiful fonts with Nix (5 points | no comments)
10. Client-side, ad-free dev utils (encoder/decoder, json format/minify, pivot, time convertor, diffs, QR generator, etc.) (7 points | 5 comments)
11. not quite buildless (6 points | no comments)
12. Announcing simkube v1.0: Record-and-replay Kubernetes simulator (4 points | 1 comment)
13. Reclaim the stack: an Heroku replacement (17 points | 12 comments)
14. Windows NT vs. Unix: A design comparison (8 points | no comments)
15. Just for Fun. No, Really (16 points | 1 comment)
16. Pico SDR (12 points | no comments)
17. proctrace - a high level profiler for process lifecycle events (5 points | no comments)
18. CAR: Copy-on-write Archive (50 points | 32 comments)
19. The State of ES5 on the Web (12 points | 7 comments)
20. What are you doing this week? (8 points | 18 comments)
21. Managing dotfiles with chezmoi (32 points | 18 comments)
22. The stacking workflow (1 points | 1 comment)
23. Possibly all the ways to get loop-finding in graphs wrong (3 points | no comments)
24. Explore AMX instructions: Unlock the performance of Apple Silicon (6 points | 4 comments)
25. Signatures are like backups (1 points | no comments)
